title: Service Advisor
description:
What To Expect
Our Service Advisors aren't just technically gifted, they are also great communicators who put the customer first, making Tesla a pioneer in automotive service with the highest customer satisfaction rate in the industry.

You will work with an international and diverse team of our best and brightest. Their experience ranges from automotive to industrial to hobbyists or career switchers, and what drives them all is Tesla's mission to accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy. Our Service Centers are strategically placed to give customers ease of access and, on occasion, you’ll also meet customers off-site. Now is your chance to help us revolutionize the way automotive service is provided and further your professional growth and skills at the same time.

What You'll Do

Respond promptly to customer inquiries via phone, email, and drive-in with a high level of attention and professionalism Assess technical issues, providing solutions over the phone when possible or escalating to the Shop Foreman/Service Manager for immediate attentionAccurately document customer concerns and data into the Dealer Management System and demonstrate extreme attention to detailConduct seamless transactions, guide customers through corrections, and summarize processes, keep customers informed with estimated completion times, regular updates, and thorough follow-up on each vehicle's statusCoordinate vehicle details before delivery and coordinate delivery or pick-up times with customers, following up to confirm satisfaction with the provided services


What You'll Bring

Knowledge of vehicle maintenance and repair methods, including familiarity with tools, materials, and techniques, hands-on experience with a diverse range of hand and power tools, shop equipment, and automotive/electrical testing devicesAbility to follow verbal and written instructions with meticulous attention to detail, and proficiency in Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS OfficeProactive willingness to learn emerging automotive technologies, establish and maintain cooperative relationships with all individuals contacted in course of work, including the publicMaintain accurate daily records and effectively manage multiple priorities to meet deadlinesMust have a valid driver’s license in country of employment
skills: ['Attention to Detail', 'Automotive', 'Automotive Sales', 'Car Service', 'Customer Satisfaction', 'Dealer Management', 'Electrical Testing', 'Management Systems', 'Problem Solving', 'Vehicle Maintenance']

title: Service Technician
description:
What To Expect
Our Tesla Service Technicians are members of the largest technician team on the planet, working together in pursuit of our mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy. Joining Tesla, means being a part of a team of the most talented Technicians and Engineers on the planet, working on cutting edge automotive technology and on the most advanced cars in production today. Our Technicians are the heart of every service location and we rely on their expertise in process improvement and in the delivery of the best service and products to our customers. We want you to elevate your professional growth through a combination of programs and on the job training, accelerating your career and unlocking your potential. With a global presence, we want to support your growth and career wherever life may take you. Our expectation is that you bring your full self to work each day, deliver high quality product, provide exceptional customer service, and help support our mission.

What You'll Do

Execute basic and advanced diagnostic and repair work on all aspects of Tesla product line, work independently and as a team to drive maximum repair efficiency Provide feedback to Tesla design and engineering teams directly to enable continuous improvement of repair procedures and products, participate with a collaborative, inclusive, and respectful attitude in an ever-changing dynamic environmentEnjoy your company supplied laptop to support diagnostics and provide online training opportunities and operate a variety of top-of-the-line hand, power and shop tools Consistently and concisely detail and document repairs, inspect and maintain shop equipment and request replacement as required Partner with other teams to ensure delivery of an exceptional product by cleaning and detailing vehicles, as needed, assist with onboarding and training of new technicians to help upskill the team


What You'll Bring

Automotive Service Technicians experience is relevant, demonstrated ability to learn new technologies and processes, and adapt to change, ability to innovate, solve complex issues, and present new ideasAssociate's Degree/ Certificate, or work experience in a related technology space (aeronautics, engines, electrical, ships, etc)Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail and proven ability to effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlinesExperience working in a team-based environment and achieving common goals and evidence of a "safety first" attitude, valid driver's license requiredBilingual skills on English and Spanish language is required, basic computer skills, including navigating web browsers and standard applications like Excel and Word
skills: ['Attention to Detail', 'Car Service', 'Computer Literacy', 'Customer Satisfaction', 'Electrical Engineering', 'Product Service', 'Spanish', 'Technical Support', 'Troubleshooting']

title: Warehouse Supervisor
description:
What To Expect
Tesla Distribution Operation is looking for a Warehouse Supervisor in Queretaro. The supervisor will oversee and manage daily operations at a forward stock location. The ideal candidate should have experience organizing work groups, coaching employees, monitoring progress, enforcing rules and ensuring quality compliance. The supervisor will follow through operational tasks and goals, big and small, with a sense of urgency and attention to detail.

To be successful at this position a supervisor must exhibit trustworthiness, excellent work ethics, open communication free of insecurities and willingness to continuously learn and adapt. A successful supervisor possesses a flexible mindset, is not intimidated by operational changes and makes processes scalable and sustainable. And above all, our warehouse supervisors are people leaders that are expected to lead by influence, with empathy and only use positional authority to enforce policies. A supervisor’s success is measured by his/her team performance and that’s where the focus should be.

You will join a well-rounded professional crew with a proven track record. You will lead a team of skillful and dedicated warehouse associates. Our culture is based on meritocracy, discipline and accountability. As a supervisor you will get to make daily operational decisions and have exposure to all levels of management. You can expect daily face-to-face time with your manager and continuous performance feedback. Lastly, we believe that hard work pays off and shall be rewarded appropriately.

What You'll Do

Manage a team of up to 10 Warehouse Associates and ensure, enhance and enforce employee safetyFoster and develop a strong Team of material handling personnel through selective recruitment, thorough and consistent on-boarding process, training, and coaching. Meet inbound and outbound operational goals, track and report KPIsEnsure successful end of shift: completed prioritized work, organized equipment, secured facility, pass down communication. Develop and implement 5S/visual management standards for a distribution center Develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures, perform root cause analysis and implement corrective actions, perform insightful and detailed bi-annual employee performance reviewsEscalate issues inhibiting the team from obtaining goals and business objectives. Purchase and track warehouse supplies and equipment. Collaborate cross-functionally with peers, internal and external partners and vendors


What You'll Bring

5+ years of experience in manufacturing, supply chain and/or distribution and logistics. Minimum of 3 years in a Supervisory/Management roleStrong knowledge of warehousing and inventory control within a distribution center with the ability to teach and coach others on best practices. Proven ability to lead others through influence and direct authorityExperience working with computers and warehouse management systems. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is desiredAbility to plan, organize and manage multiple projects with competing demands and deadlines. Ability to maintain trustworthy business relationships and be a peacemaker in conflicts. Ability to negotiate effectively and reach agreements with internal and external stakeholdersExcellent written and verbal communication skills required in both english and spanish


, Tesla
skills: ['Communication Training', 'Inventory Control', 'Key Performance Indicators', 'Logistics Management', 'Material Handling', 'Oral Communication', 'Peacemaker', 'Spanish', 'Supervisory Skills', 'Supply Chain Management']
